page.title: 08Guy's Cliffe, Warwick.
page.content: Legend tells that it is here that Guy of Warwick lived the life of a hermit, after having killed various monsters as well as a Danish Giant. During his life he is said to have married Lady Felice, daughter of the Earl of Warwick in the early 10th century. A short while later he went on a pilgrimage to the holy land, after he had himself become Earl of Warwick. While he was away, Felice became a nun, giving all she had to the poor. Guy returned and began his life of solitude in the caves.Only as he was dying did Felice come to see him and he died in her arms. The caves in the cliffs here were the retreats of hermites. There is also a ruined Elizabethen mansion close by. Mr. P. Morrel, a local teacher and musician has written a musical version of the story of the GUY OF WARWICK.
